intro: Papaver uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces a single, showy bloom per stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The seeds of Papaver uniflorum are often used in culinary applications, particularly in the production of poppy seed oil and as a spice.
